content: Write a sonnet about spring with each line beginning with consecutive letters of the alphabet.

Awakening buds in emerald hues unfurl,
Blossoms dance upon the gentle breeze.
Cascading streams sing songs of life's rebirth,
Dappled sunlight paints the earth with cheer.

Every tree dons a new attire of green,
Frolicking lambs skip through the meadows wide.
Gardens bloom with colors so serene,
Heralding spring's arrival far and nigh.

Icy hearts begin to thaw and melt,
Joyous birds serenade the morning light.
Kaleidoscope of flowers takes its spell,
Lush landscapes stretch towards the endless sky.

Majestic spring, thou art a wondrous sight,
Nature's symphony in vibrant delight.
